facts: A lightning bolt can heat the air around it to about 30,000Â°C, which is hotter than the surface of the Sun.
Thunder is the sound made when lightning rapidly heats the air and causes it to expand like a shock wave.
A hurricane gets its energy from warm ocean water, and it weakens when it moves over cooler water or land.
A rainbow forms when sunlight is bent and reflected inside raindrops, splitting white light into many colors.
Hailstones grow in strong thunderstorm clouds when updrafts lift them over and over through freezing layers.
The highest clouds, called cirrus clouds, are made of tiny ice crystals and often signal a change in weather.
Tornadoes can spin at very high speeds, but they are usually much smaller and shorter-lived than hurricanes.
